demographics.description: Basic demographic questions including gender, age, and education

response.prompt: What is your **gender**?
What is your **age**?
For how many years have you worked or studied in the field of visualization design?
response.placeholder: Enter your years of experience, range from 0 - 120

tutorial_bar_geo-icon.instruction:
### Get Familiar with the Texture Design Tool 

 Now you can play with the tool and try each function out. Once you are familiar with the tool, click the **Start Real Experiment** button at the bottom right of the page to start the real experiment.

bar-geo_geo-icon.instruction:
### Now it's your turn to design an effective set of textures for data visualization.

 Imagine you are asked to create a chart with texture for a high-resolution e-ink display which can only show black and white content. This chart shows the result of a survey about people's favourite vegetables. 

 Please adjust the texture parameters to create an aesthetically pleasing and readable visualization.

 Please optimize for datasets in general. Click the change data set button to test your design on different random data sets, and click the default data set button to test your design on a default data set.

When you finish designing, click on the **Next** button. There is no time limit for this task, but keep in mind that we will ask you to complete one other design after this one.

response.prompt: get-measurements

map-geo_geo-icon.instruction:
### Now it's your turn to design an effective set of textures for data visualization.

 Imagine you are asked to create a chart with texture for a high-resolution e-ink display which can only show black and white content. This map shows the favorite vegetable of the residents of each French department. 

 Please adjust the texture parameters to create an aesthetically pleasing and readable visualization.

 Please optimize for datasets in general. Click the change data set button to test your design on different random data sets, and click the default data set button to test your design on a default data set.

When you finish designing, click on the **Next** button. There is no time limit for this task. This is the last design task.

response.prompt: get-measurements

question-design-strategies_bar_geo-icon.instruction:
### Design Strategies 

 You have completed the design of two charts, thanks a lot! Here are your two designs and some questions about your design strategies.

response.prompt: What kind of **goals** did you want to achieve when you designed the representation?
When you chose the parameters for the **geometric textures**, did you use any methods or principles?
When you chose the parameters for the **iconic textures**, did you use any methods or principles?

response.prompt: What's your general impression, experience, or take-away about using geometric and iconic textures for data representation?

question-different-chart-geo_bar.instruction:
### Geometric Texture on Different Charts 

 We applied the geometric texture you designed to a pie chart and a map.

response.prompt: Do you think they still work in this context? Please explain.
